indications.text: digoxin cardiac glycoside indicated : • treatment mild moderate heart failure adults . ( 1.1 ) • control resting ventricular rate adults chronic atrial fibrillation . ( 1.2 )

name: Digoxin
indications_original: Digoxin is a cardiac glycoside indicated for: • Treatment of mild to moderate heart failure in adults. ( 1.1 ) • Control of resting ventricular rate in adults with chronic atrial fibrillation. ( 1.2 )
contraindications_original: Digoxin dose is based on patient-specific factors (age, lean body weight, renal function, etc.). See full prescribing information. Monitor for toxicity and therapeutic effect. ( 2 ) Intravenous administration is preferable to intramuscular. Avoid bolus administration. ( 2 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Digoxin Injection, USP is available as:
                  500 mcg/2 mL (250 mcg/mL) ampuls packaged:
                  Overbagged with 5 x 2 mL ampuls in each bag, NDC 55154-5106-5
                  WARNING: This Unit Dose package is not child resistant and is Intended for Institutional Use Only. Keep this and all drugs out of the reach of children.
                  
                     Store at 20˚ to 25˚C (68˚ to 77˚F), excursions permitted to 15˚ to 30˚C (59˚ to 86˚F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Protect from light.
adverseReactions_original:
Digoxin is contraindicated in patients with:
                  
                     
                        •Ventricular fibrillation [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1)]
                     
                     
                        •Known hypersensitivity to digoxin (reactions seen include unexplained rash, swelling of the mouth, lips or throat or a difficulty in breathing). A hypersensitivity reaction to other digitalis preparations usually constitutes a contraindication to digoxin.
